meanings.definition: The form of energy associated with the motion of atoms or molecules and capable of being transmitted through solid and fluid media by conduction, through fluid media by convection, and through empty space by radiation.
The condition or quality of being hot; high temperature.
A period of intense or extreme weather, such as a heat wave.
A source of heat, such as a stove or furnace.
Intensity of feeling, especially of anger or excitement.
